briefdescription.para: Map a logical CPU ID to its LAPIC ID.

simplesect.para: uint32_t LAPIC ID for the given logical CPU ID.

briefdescription.para: Map a LAPIC ID to its logical CPU ID.

parameterdescription.para: LAPIC ID as reported by hardware.

simplesect.para: uint8_t Logical CPU ID assigned to this LAPIC ID, or 255 if unmapped.

briefdescription.para: Get the total number of IOAPICs detected in the system.
Retrieve the IOAPIC structure by index.

simplesect.para: ioapic_t structure containing details of the IOAPIC

briefdescription.para: Detect SMP CPU cores and APICs (Local and IOAPIC).

detaileddescription.para: This function parses the MADT (APIC table) and sets up CPU topology and IOAPIC data.

briefdescription.para: Read the current value of the ACPI Power Management (PM) timer.

detaileddescription.para: The PM timer is a free-running counter defined by the ACPI FADT. It increments at a fixed rate of 3.579545 MHz, and is either 24-bit (wraps every ~4.6 seconds) or 32-bit (wraps every ~1193 seconds), depending on platform capabilities.
This function automatically handles masking based on the width reported in the FADT (via pm_timer_is_32_bit()) and returns the raw counter value.

simplesect.para: The current PM timer count, masked to 24 or 32 bits. Returns 0 if the PM timer is not available.

briefdescription.para: Check if the ACPI PM timer is available on this system.

detaileddescription.para: Availability is determined from the FADT (either PM_TMR_BLK or X_PM_TMR_BLK). If no valid address is reported, the timer is considered unavailable and alternative calibration sources (e.g. RTC) must be used.

simplesect.para: true if the PM timer is present and usable, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Query whether the PM timer operates in 32-bit mode.

detaileddescription.para: This information is derived from the TMR_VAL_EXT flag in the FADT. If set, the PM timer is 32-bit and wraps approximately every 1193 seconds. If clear, it is 24-bit and wraps every ~4.6 seconds.

simplesect.para: true if the PM timer is 32-bit, false if it is 24-bit.

briefdescription.para: Initialise and bring Application Processors (APs) online via Limine SMP.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the Limine SMP response to discover all CPUs in the system, map their LAPIC IDs to logical CPU IDs, and assign each AP an entry point (kmain_ap). The Bootstrap Processor (BSP) is detected and skipped, as are CPUs with processor IDs >= 255 (reserved for broadcast or outside kernel limits).
Once all eligible APs are assigned their startup entry point, this function spins until each AP reports online by incrementing aps_online.

simplesect.para: This does not directly issue INIT/SIPI IPIs; Limine handles the actual startup of APs. The kernel only assigns the entry function and waits.
Systems with more than 254 CPUs are truncated to 254 usable cores.

briefdescription.para: Translate a legacy IRQ number (0–15) into a GSI using overrides.

simplesect.para: Global System Interrupt (GSI) for the IRQ

briefdescription.para: Determine the interrupt polarity of a given IRQ.

simplesect.para: 0 for active high, 1 for active low

briefdescription.para: Determine the trigger mode of a given IRQ.

memberdef.argsstring: (uacpi_u32 irq, uacpi_interrupt_handler handler, uacpi_handle ctx, uacpi_handle *out_irq_handle)
memberdef.name: uacpi_kernel_install_interrupt_handler

briefdescription.para: Return human-readable string for trigger mode.
Return human-readable string for IRQ sharing model.

simplesect.para: Descriptive string of the IRQ sharing status
